content: brk with double knit 1×1 rib two-colour work knit stitches in the colour facing you slip the opposite-colour stitches as required to form a clean reversible fabric © 2026 qing studio ltd this the resting yarn to close the edge neatly sl2yo bring yarn to the front of the work slip the next 2 stitches individually purlwise then bring the yarn over the right needle to the back result 2 slipped stitches on the needle paired with a single yarn over strand brp3tog purl the next 2 slipped stitches together with their accompanying yarn over as one stitch tapestry bind-off 1×1 use a standard sewn/tapestry bind-off for 1×1 rib elastic reversible finish buttonholes & buttons optional buttonholes are placed by rs row count and worked as you knit ensuring consistent spacing as the fabric grows and relaxes detailed instructions for working the buttonholes can be found in section 2-d button-free option if you prefer not to work buttonholes simply work both front bands straight in double knit throughout the cardigan may be worn open or secured with a shawl pin or belt © 2026 qing studio ltd this pattern is for personal use only no part of this publication may be reproduced distributed or sold without written permission 5 pattern begin section 1 neckband a cast on the neck is worked as a double-knit band provisional cast-on with 3 mm needles 2-4mm hook and waste yarn make a crochet provisional cast-on for 79 sts set-up row 1 rs with cc knit set-up row 2 ws purl set-up row 3 rs with mc knit set-up row 4 ws purl release 79 live stitches from the cast-on edge by carefully unzipping and removing the crochet provisional cast-on chain while placing these stitches onto a second set of needles make sure you have the same number of stitches on each needle bring the needle with the cast-on stitches up behind the working needle with the wrong sides together double knit 1x1 rib from this point onward the fabric is worked in two-colour 1×1 rib double knit with each full row completed in two passes one pass with mc one pass with cc structure rule ● mc is always worked first on every row ● each full row = 1 mc pass + 1 cc pass edge control at every turn cross the working yarns so they are caught together this creates a closed tidy edge © 2026 qing studio ltd this pattern is for personal use only no part of this publication may be reproduced distributed or sold
